data.event: Douglas was founded in 1855 as the seat of the newly formed Coffee County.
It was named for Senator Stephen A. Douglas, a renowned stump speaker and congressman who was the presidential challenger to Abraham Lincoln in the election of 1860.

event.title: was chartered as a town in 1895

data.event: Douglas was chartered as a town in 1895 and as a city in 1897.
In 1895, the railroad came to Douglas and the community began to boom.

event.title: 1909, the Georgia and Florida Railway located

data.event: In 1909, the Georgia and Florida Railway located its offices in Douglas.
The Eleventh District Agricultural & Mechanical School was established in Douglas in 1906.
In 1927, South Georgia College became Georgia's first state-supported junior college.
During the 1920s and 1930s, Douglas became one of the major tobacco markets in the state.
